required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Finding Study in Adults With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)(174007/P05805/MK-8777-003)
clinical_study.official_title: A Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Randomized, Two Period 4-Arm Trial to Investigate the Dose-Related Efficacy and Safety of Org 26576 in Adults With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase 2 multicenter, randomized, double-blind trial of MK-8777 (Org 26576, SCH 900777) in adult subjects with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD). MK-8777 or placebo will be administered in a crossover fashion for two 3-week treatment periods. The two 3-week treatment periods will be separated by a 2-week placebo washout period.
The primary objective is to compare the efficacy of various doses of MK-8777 to that of placebo in the treatment of ADHD symptoms in adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Adult Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) Investigator Symptom Rating Scale (AISRS) Score
primary_outcome.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition (DSM-IV) diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician's rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. For the statistical analyses, the average score from Day 14 and Day 21 was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least a 30% Reduction From Baseline in AISRS Score
secondary_outcome.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition (DSM-IV) diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician's rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. Reduction was defined as the relative change from the baseline score within a treatment period to post-baseline score within that treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least a 50% Reduction From Baseline in AISRS Score
secondary_outcome.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the DSM-IV diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician's rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. Reduction was defined as the relative change from the baseline score within a treatment period to post-baseline score within that treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experience At Least One Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after last dose of study drug (Up to 63 days)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of an investigational product, whether or not related to the investigational product. AEs are reported by study drug taken at time of event and not by randomly assigned sequence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinue Study Drug Due to an AE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to last dose of study drug (Up to 56 days)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of an investigational product, whether or not related to the investigational product. AEs are reported by study drug taken at time of event and not by randomly assigned sequence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinician Global Impression Scale - Severity (CGI-S) Category Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-S is a 7-point clinician-rated scale for assessing the global severity of ADHD. Scores could range from 1=Normal, not at all ill to 7=Among the most extremely ill, with a higher score indicating more severe illness. Categorization was as follows: 1=Normal, not at all ill and Borderline mentally ill; 2=Mildly ill; 3=Moderately ill and 4=Markedly ill, Severely ill and Among the most extremely ill patients, with a higher category indicating more severe illness. Analysis of CGI-S was performed using a proportional odds model. For statistical analyses, CGI-S assessments were condensed to one assessment of severity per treatment period by taking the most severe score at the second and third visits within a treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinician Global Impression Scale - Improvement (CGI-I) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-I is a 7-point clinician-rated scale for assessing the global improvement of ADHD. Scores could range from 1=Very much improved to 4=No change to 7=Very much worse, with a lower score indicating the most improvement. Analysis of CGI-I was performed using a proportional odds model. For statistical analyses, CGI-I assessments were condensed to one assessment of improvement per treatment period by taking the worst improvement score at the second and third visits within a treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The ESS is an 8-item scale used to assess sleepiness. The test consists of a list of 8 situations in which participants rate their tendency to become sleepy on a scale of 0=Would never doze to 3=High chance of dozing. The scores for each of the 8 situations are added to create a total score on a scale with a range from of 0 to 24. A higher score indicates a greater degree of sleepiness. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The PSQI is a participant-rated scale to assess the quality of sleep. The PSQI consists of 7 component scores: subjective sleep quality, sleep latency, sleep duration, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, use of sleeping medication, and daytime dysfunction. Each component score can range from 0=better (i.e., 0 times per month) to 3=worse (i.e., 3 or more times per week). The sum of these 7 component scores yields one total score with a range of 0 (better) to 21 (worse). A total PSQI score <=5 is associated with good sleep quality; a total score >5 is associated with poor sleep quality. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Quick Inventory of Depression Symptomology - Clinician Rating (QIDS-C) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The QIDS-C is a clinician-administered rating scale to measure the severity of depressive symptoms within the 9 DSM-IV major depression disorder symptom (MDD) domains: depressed mood, loss of interest or pleasure, concentration/decision making, self-outlook, suicidal ideation, energy/fatigability, sleep, weight/appetite change, and psychomotor changes. There is one score (0=none to 3=severe) for each of the of the 9 domains. The total score is obtained by adding the scores for each of the 9 symptom domains. QIDS-C total scores can range from 0 to 27, with a higher score indicating more severe depression. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Time-Sensitive ADHD Symptom Scale (TASS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The TASS is a participant-administered scale to assess study drug effects in the evening. Participants respond to 18 questions about ADHD symptoms, with scores from 0=Not at all to 3=Severe. Total scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating more severe ADHD symtoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Cognitive Flexibility
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing (©CNS Vital Signs, Chapel Hill, NC) battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of cognitive flexibility (score range: -200 to 200), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Complex Attention
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of complex attention (score range: 0 to 250), with a lower score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Composite Memory
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of composite memory (score range: -120 to 120), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Executive Functioning
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of executive functioning (score range: -200 to 200), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Speed of Processing
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of speed of processing (score range: -1000 to 200), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Reaction Time
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of reaction time (lowest time possible is 0 msec), with a lower reaction time indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Reasoning
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of reasoning (score range: -15 to 15), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Sustained Attention
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of sustained attention (score range -120 to 120), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Verbal Memory
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of verbal memory (score range: -60 to 60), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Visual Memory
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of visual memory (score range: -60 to 60), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Working Memory
secondary_outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of working memory (score range: -48 to 48), with a higher score indicating better cognition.

arm_group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose (FD) of MK-8777 100 mg twice each day (BID) for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive a fixed dose of placebo (PBO) BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

Participants receive a fixed dose of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

Participants receive rising doses (RD) of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive rising doses of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

Participants receive rising doses of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: MK-8777 FD→PBO
group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose (FD) of MK-8777 100 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive a fixed dose of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: MK-8777 RD→PBO
group.description: Participants receive rising doses (RD) of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive rising doses of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants receive rising doses of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: MK-8777 FD→PBO
group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose FD of MK-8777 100 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive a fixed dose of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: MK-8777 RD→PBO
group.description: Participants receive rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive rising doses of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants receive rising doses of placebo BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 1). After a 2-week placebo washout period, participants receive rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks (Treatment Period 2).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Adult Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) Investigator Symptom Rating Scale (AISRS) Score
outcome.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition (DSM-IV) diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician’s rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. For the statistical analyses, the average score from Day 14 and Day 21 was used.
outcome.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline AISRS efficacy assessment. Results are reported by the study drug being administered at time of assessment and not by randomly assigned sequence.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100mg: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Adult Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) Investigator Symptom Rating Scale (AISRS) Score
measure.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition (DSM-IV) diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician’s rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. For the statistical analyses, the average score from Day 14 and Day 21 was used.
measure.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline AISRS efficacy assessment. Results are reported by the study drug being administered at time of assessment and not by randomly assigned sequence.

analysis.groups_desc: The treatment difference between 100 mg MK-8777 fixed dose and Placebo was estimated for the average effect (average change from baseline) of the 2nd and 3rd week of each period (Day 14 and Day 21).
analysis.p_value_desc: To correct for multiplicity, p-values (2-sided) should be compared with the 2.5% level of significance.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mixed Model for Repeated Measurements (MMRM) with fixed effects for treatment, period, visit, center and treatment by visit interaction, and random effect for participant, and baseline AISRS score as covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: The treatment difference between 100-300 mg MK-8777 rising dose and Placebo was estimated for the average effect (average change from baseline) of the 2nd and 3rd week of each period (Day 14 and Day 21).
analysis.p_value_desc: To correct for multiplicity, p-values (2-sided) should be compared with the 2.5% level of significance.
analysis.estimate_desc: MMRM with fixed effects for treatment, period, visit, center and treatment by visit interaction, and random effect for participant, and baseline AISRS score as covariate.

outcome.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the DSM-IV diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician’s rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100mg: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With at Least a 50% Reduction From Baseline in AISRS Score
measure.description: The AISRS is an 18-item clinician-rated instrument for assessing the 18 core symptoms of ADHD corresponding to the DSM-IV diagnostic symptoms for adults. Based on the clinician’s rating for each of the symptoms using a 4-point scale (0=None to 3=Severe), the AISRS total score is derived by summing the score assigned to each of the 18 symptoms. Scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating a more severe ADHD symptoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2. measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug, and who had at least one postbaseline AISRS efficacy assessment.

analysis.estimate_desc: Since no participants in the Placebo group achieved a 50% reduction, the comparison was done using a Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel method and 0.5 was added to both groups.
Logistic regression with fixed effects for treatment and period, and baseline AISRS score as covariate.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experience At Least One Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of an investigational product, whether or not related to the investigational product. AEs are reported by study drug taken at time of event and not by randomly assigned sequence.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after last dose of study drug (Up to 63 days)
outcome.population: The All-Subjects-Treated (AST) population consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of randomized study drug within at least one of the two treatment periods (excluding the placebo run-in period).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants receive placebo BID for 3 weeks.

group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID for 3 weeks.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg
group.description: Participants receive rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for 3 weeks.

Scores could range from 1=Very much improved to 4=No change to 7=Very much worse, with a lower score indicating the most improvement. Analysis of CGI-I was performed using a proportional odds model. For statistical analyses, CGI-I assessments were condensed to one assessment of improvement per treatment period by taking the worst improvement score at the second and third visits within a treatment period.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug, and who had at least one postbaseline CGI-I efficacy assessment.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100mg: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinician Global Impression Scale - Improvement (CGI-I) Scores
measure.description: The CGI-I is a 7-point clinician-rated scale for assessing the global improvement of ADHD. Scores could range from 1=Very much improved to 4=No change to 7=Very much worse, with a lower score indicating the most improvement. Analysis of CGI-I was performed using a proportional odds model. For statistical analyses, CGI-I assessments were condensed to one assessment of improvement per treatment period by taking the worst improvement score at the second and third visits within a treatment period.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug, and who had at least one postbaseline CGI-I efficacy assessment.

analysis.estimate_desc: Proportional odds model with fixed effects for treatment and period.
Proportional odds model with fixed effects for treatment and period.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) Score
outcome.description: The ESS is an 8-item scale used to assess sleepiness. The test consists of a list of 8 situations in which participants rate their tendency to become sleepy on a scale of 0=Would never doze to 3=High chance of dozing. The scores for each of the 8 situations are added to create a total score on a scale with a range from of 0 to 24. A higher score indicates a greater degree of sleepiness. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline ESS efficacy assessment.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100mg: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) Score
measure.description: The ESS is an 8-item scale used to assess sleepiness. The test consists of a list of 8 situations in which participants rate their tendency to become sleepy on a scale of 0=Would never doze to 3=High chance of dozing. The scores for each of the 8 situations are added to create a total score on a scale with a range from of 0 to 24. A higher score indicates a greater degree of sleepiness. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline ESS efficacy assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: The treatment difference between 100 mg MK-8777 fixed dose and Placebo was estimated for the average effect (average change from baseline) of the 2nd and 3rd week of each period (Day 14 and Day 21).
analysis.p_value_desc: To correct for multiplicity, p-values (2-sided) should be compared with the 2.5% level of significance.
analysis.estimate_desc: MMRM with fixed effects for treatment, period, visit, center and treatment by visit interaction, and random effect for participant, and baseline ESS score as covariate. For statistical analyses, the average score from Days 14 and 21 was used.

analysis.groups_desc: The treatment difference between 100-300 mg MK-8777 rising dose and Placebo was estimated for the average effect (average change from baseline) of the 2nd and 3rd week of each period (Day 14 and Day 21).
analysis.p_value_desc: To correct for multiplicity, p-values (2-sided) should be compared with the 2.5% level of significance.
analysis.estimate_desc: MMRM with fixed effects for treatment, period, visit, center and treatment by visit interaction, and random effect for participant, and baseline ESS score as covariate. For statistical analyses, the average score from Days 14 and 21 was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Score
outcome.description: The PSQI is a participant-rated scale to assess the quality of sleep. The PSQI consists of 7 component scores: subjective sleep quality, sleep latency, sleep duration, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, use of sleeping medication, and daytime dysfunction. Each component score can range from 0=better (i.e., 0 times per month) to 3=worse (i.e., 3 or more times per week). The sum of these 7 component scores yields one total score with a range of 0 (better) to 21 (worse). A total PSQI score <=5 is associated with good sleep quality; a total score >5 is associated with poor sleep quality. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline PSQI efficacy assessment.

group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100mg: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

The sum of these 7 component scores yields one total score with a range of 0 (better) to 21 (worse). A total PSQI score <=5 is associated with good sleep quality; a total score >5 is associated with poor sleep quality. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline PSQI efficacy assessment.

analysis.estimate_desc: MMRM with fixed effects for treatment, period, visit, center and treatment by visit interaction, and random effect for participant, and baseline PSQI score as covariate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Quick Inventory of Depression Symptomology - Clinician Rating (QIDS-C) Score
outcome.description: The QIDS-C is a clinician-administered rating scale to measure the severity of depressive symptoms within the 9 DSM-IV major depression disorder symptom (MDD) domains: depressed mood, loss of interest or pleasure, concentration/decision making, self-outlook, suicidal ideation, energy/fatigability, sleep, weight/appetite change, and psychomotor changes. There is one score (0=none to 3=severe) for each of the of the 9 domains. The total score is obtained by adding the scores for each of the 9 symptom domains. QIDS-C total scores can range from 0 to 27, with a higher score indicating more severe depression. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline QIDS-C efficacy assessment.

group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

There is one score (0=none to 3=severe) for each of the of the 9 domains. The total score is obtained by adding the scores for each of the 9 symptom domains. outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Time-Sensitive ADHD Symptom Scale (TASS) Score
outcome.description: The TASS is a participant-administered scale to assess study drug effects in the evening. Participants respond to 18 questions about ADHD symptoms, with scores from 0=Not at all to 3=Severe. Total scores can range from 0 to 54, with a higher score indicating more severe ADHD symtoms. Baseline was defined as the score at the baseline visit prior to starting dosing for Period 1 and as the last score in the 2-week placebo wash-out period for Period 2.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline TASS efficacy assessment.

group.description: Participants who received rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

outcome.title: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Cognitive Flexibility
outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing (©CNS Vital Signs, Chapel Hill, NC) battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of cognitive flexibility (score range: -200 to 200), with a higher score indicating better cognition.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline computerized cognition efficacy assessment for cognitive flexibility.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Verbal Memory
measure.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of verbal memory (score range: -60 to 60), with a higher score indicating better cognition.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline computerized cognition efficacy assessment for verbal memory.

outcome.title: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Visual Memory
outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of visual memory (score range: -60 to 60), with a higher score indicating better cognition.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline computerized cognition efficacy assessment for visual memory.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 FD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 FD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.description: Participants who received a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: Placebo: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg: MK-8777 RD→PBO OR PBO→MK-8777 RD
group.description: Participants who received rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Visual Memory
measure.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of visual memory (score range: -60 to 60), with a higher score indicating better cognition.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline computerized cognition efficacy assessment for visual memory.

outcome.title: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Working Memory
outcome.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of working memory (score range: -48 to 48), with a higher score indicating better cognition.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline computerized cognition efficacy assessment for working memory.

group.description: Participants who received placebo in either Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.title: Computerized Cognition Assessment: Working Memory
measure.description: Cognition was assessed by a computerized cognitive testing battery consisting of neuropsychological tests that measure the cognitive domain of working memory (score range: -48 to 48), with a higher score indicating better cognition.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of all participants who were randomized, who received at least one dose of study drug in at least one period, and who had at least one postbaseline computerized cognition efficacy assessment for working memory.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last dose of study drug (Up to 12 weeks).
reported_events.desc: AEs are reported by study drug taken at time of event and not by randomly assigned sequence.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants receive placebo BID for up to 5 weeks.

group.title: MK-8777 100mg
group.description: Participants receive a fixed dose of MK-8777 100 mg BID for up to 3 weeks.

group.title: MK-8777 100-300mg
group.description: Participants receive rising doses of MK-8777 100-300 mg BID for up to 3 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
